title: ASP.NET Core updates in .NET 7 Release Candidate 1
description: .NET 7 Release Candidate 1 (RC1) is now available and includes many great new improvements to ASP.NET Core.

title: Best practices for creating a modern npm package
description: While npm is 12 years old, your practices around npm package creation should hopefully be a lot more modern.

title: Build skills that open doors—with Microsoft Learn
Building the main navigation for a website
description: This tutorial describes how to build an accessible main navigation of a website. You learn about semantic HTML, accessibility, and how using ARIA attributes can sometimes do more harm than good.

title: How To Improve Largest Contentful Paint for Faster Load Times
description: A faster LCP is a leading indicator of when your page’s most critical content appears and how fast the overall load process is—both things people like in a website.

title: Intro to Blitz.js: A full-stack framework for Next.js
description: Blitz.js takes a zero-API approach to connecting your Next.js front end to the back-end datastore. Here's how it works.

title: JavaScript APIs You Don’t Know About
description: In this article, Jaun Diego covers the least known yet extremely useful APIs, such as the Page Visibility API, Web Sharing API, Broadcast Channel API and Internationalization API.

title: MemLab: An open source framework for finding JavaScript memory leaks
description: Finding and addressing the root cause of memory leaks is important for delivering a quality user experience on web applications.

title: The future of the web will need a different sort of software developer
description: Mental note: buy a shiny jumpsuit with shoulder pads

title: Visual Studio devs can now roll back problematic updates
Webb space telescope images Mars for the first time
description: "And invisible to me because it was so remote and small, flying swiftly and steadily towards me across that incredible distance, drawing nearer every minute by so many thousands of miles, came the Thing they were sending us"
